quotes.text: A grateful heart is a beginning of greatness. It is an expression of humility. It is a foundation for the development of such virtues as prayer, faith, courage, contentment, happiness, love, and well-being.
quotes.author: James E. Faust

quotes.text: Self-esteem is as important to our well-being as legs are to a table. It is essential for physical and mental health and for happiness.
quotes.author: Louise Hart

quotes.text: Wellness is the compete integration of body, mind, and spirit - the realization that everything we do, think, feel, and believe has an effect on our state of well-being.
quotes.author: Greg Anderson

quotes.text: Well-being cannot exist just in your own head. Well-being is a combination of feeling good as well as actually having meaning, good relationships and accomplishment.
quotes.author: Martin Sligman

quotes.text: The simplification of life is one of the steps to inner peace. A persistent simplification will create an inner and outer well-being that places harmony in one's life.
quotes.author: Peace Pilgrim

quotes.text: The real sin against life is to abuse and destroy beauty, even one's own even more, one's own, for that has been put in our care and we are responsible for its well-being.
quotes.author: Katherine Anne Porter

quotes.text: No man, who continues to add something to the material, intellectual and moral well-being of the place in which he lives, is left long without proper reward.
quotes.author: Booker T. Washington

quotes.text: If we can find forgiveness in our hearts for those who have caused us hurt and injury, we will rise to a higher level of self-esteem and well-being.
quotes.author: James E. Faust

quotes.text: More compassionate mind, more sense of concern for other's well-being, is source of happiness.
quotes.author: Dalai Lama

quotes.text: Human well-being is not a random phenomenon. It depends on many factors - ranging from genetics and neurobiology to sociology and economics. But, clearly, there are scientific truths to be known about how we can flourish in this world. Wherever we can have an impact on the well-being of others, questions of morality apply.
quotes.author: Sam Harris

quotes.text: Healing comes from taking responsibility: to realize that it is you - and no one else - that creates your thoughts, your feelings, and your actions.
quotes.author: Peter Shepherd

quotes.text: Life is a journey and if you fall in love with the journey you will be in love forever.
quotes.author: Peter Hagerty

quotes.text: Life begins as a quest of the child for the man, and ends as a journey by the man to rediscover the child.
quotes.author: Sam Ewing

quotes.text: Ultimately your greatest teacher is to live with an open heart.
quotes.author: Emmanuel (Pat Rodegast)

quotes.text: Doing what you like is freedom. Liking what you do is happiness.
quotes.author: Frank Tyger

quotes.text: Be content with what you have; rejoice in the way things are. When you realize there is nothing lacking, the world belongs to you.
quotes.author: Lao Tzu

quotes.text: If you are depressed you are living in the past. If you are anxious you are living in the future. If you are at peace you are living in the present.
quotes.author: Lao Tzu

quotes.text: A good traveler has no fixed plans and is not intent on arriving.
quotes.author: Lao Tzu

quotes.text: When you are content to be simply yourself and don't compare or compete, everyone will respect you.
quotes.author: Lao Tzu

quotes.text: You cannot judge what should bring others joy, and others cannot judge what should bring you joy.
quotes.author: Alan Cohen

quotes.text: Start by doing what's necessary; then do what's possible; and suddenly you are doing the impossible.
quotes.author: Francis of Assisi

quotes.text: The best and the most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen or even touched - they must be felt with the heart.
quotes.author: Helen Keller

quotes.text: Stop trying to hit me and hit me.
quotes.author: Morpheus

quotes.text: Everything looks better in the morning.
quotes.author: John Galliano

quotes.text: Perfection is not attainable, but if we chase perfection we can catch excellence.
quotes.author: Vince Lombardi

quotes.text: I can't change the direction of the wind, but I can adjust my sails to always reach my destination.
quotes.author: Jimmy Dean

quotes.text: Nothing is impossible, the word itself says 'I'm possible'.
quotes.author: Audrey Hepburn

quotes.text: Bran thought about it. 'Can a man still be brave if he's afraid?' 'That is the only time a man can be brave,' His father told him.
quotes.author: George R.R. Martin

quotes.text: The glow of one warm though is to me worth more than money.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.text: What lies behind you and what lies in front of you, pales in comparison to what lies inside of you.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.text: There is no such thing as a problem without a gift for you in its hands. You seek problems because you need their gifts.
quotes.author: Richard Bach

quotes.text: If you want to be happy, set a goal that commands your thoughts, liberates your energy, and inspires your hopes.
quotes.author: Andrew Carnegie

quotes.text: The journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.
quotes.author: Lao Tzu

quotes.text: Time is a created thing. To say 'I don't have time', is like saying, 'I don't want to'.
quotes.author: Lao Tzu

quotes.text: Do you want to know who you are? Don't ask. Act! Action will delineate and define you.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.text: The individual who says it is not possible should move out of the way of those doing it.
quotes.author: Tricia Cunningham

quotes.text: Be happy with what you have. Be excited about what you want.
quotes.author: Alan Cohen

quotes.text: Of course motivation is not permanent. But then, neither is bathing; but it is something you should do on a regular basis.
quotes.author: Zig Ziglar

quotes.text: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.
quotes.author: Walt Disney Company

quotes.text: The only thing standing between you and your goal is the bullshit story you keep telling yourself as to why you can't achieve it.
quotes.author: Jordan Belfort

quotes.text: It is in health that is real wealth and not pieces of gold and silver.
quotes.author: Mahatma Ghandi

quotes.text: To keep the body in good health is a duty, otherwise we shall not be able to keep our mind strong and clear.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: Being in control of your life and having realistic expectations about your day-to-day challenges are the key to stress management, which is perhaps the most important ingredient to living a healthy, happy and rewarding life.
quotes.author: Marilu Henner

quotes.text: Early to bed and early to rise makes a man healthy, wealthy and wise.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.text: Health is not valued until sickness comes.
quotes.author: Thomas Fuller

quotes.text: A healthy attitude is contagious but don't wait to catch it from others. Be a carrier.
quotes.author: Tom Stoppard

quotes.text: The first wealth is healt.h
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.text: The wish for health has always been half of health.
quotes.author: Lucious Annaeus Seneca

quotes.text: Healing is a matter of time but it is also a matter of opportunity.
quotes.author: Hippocrates

quotes.text: If you're happy, if you're feeling good, then nothing else matters.
quotes.author: Robin Wright

quotes.text: The secret of health for both mind and body is not to mourn for the past, nor to worry about the future, but to live the present moment wisely and earnestly.
quotes.author: Gautama Buddha

quotes.text: Keep your best wishes, close to your heart and watch what happens.
quotes.author: Tony DeLiso

quotes.text: I heard a definition once: Happiness is health and a short memory! I wish I'd invented it, because it is very true.
quotes.author: Audrey Hepburn

quotes.text: A fit, healthy body—that is the best fashion statement.
quotes.author: Jess C. Scott

quotes.text: I promise you nothing is as chaotic as it seems. Nothing is worth diminishing your health. Nothing is worth poisoning yourself into stress, anxiety, and fear.
quotes.author: Steve Maraboli

quotes.text: Tension is who you think you should be, relaxation is who you are.
quotes.author: Ancient Chinese Proverb

quotes.text: Healthy citizens are the greatest asset any country can have.
quotes.author: Winston S. Churchill

quotes.text: My grandmother started walking five miles a day when she was sixty. She's ninety-seven now, and we don't know where the heck she is.
quotes.author: Ellen DeGeneres

quotes.text: A bear, however hard he tries, grows tubby without exercise.
quotes.author: A.A. Milne

quotes.text: An early-morning walk is a blessing for the whole day.
quotes.author: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.text: Grief does not change you, Hazel. It reveals you.
quotes.author: John Green

quotes.text: I will not say, do not weep, for not all tears are an evil.
quotes.author: J.R.R Tolkien

quotes.text: Don’t grieve. Anything you lose comes round in another form.
quotes.author: Rumi

quotes.text: Tears shed for another person are not a sign of weakness. They are a sign of a pure heart.
quotes.author: Jose N. Harris

quotes.text: Only people who are capable of loving strongly can also suffer great sorrow, but this same necessity of loving serves to counteract their grief and heals them.
quotes.author: Leo Tolstoy

quotes.text: No one ever told me that grief felt so like fear.
quotes.author: C.S Lewis

quotes.text: They say time heals all wounds, but that presumes the source of the grief is finite.
quotes.author: Cassandra Clare

quotes.text: Grief is not as heavy as guilt, but it takes more away from you.
quotes.author: Veronica Roth

quotes.text: To weep is to make less the depth of grief.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.text: Grief can be a burden, but also an anchor. You get used to the weight, how it holds you in place.
quotes.author: Sarah Dessen

quotes.text: Everything is a gift of the universe —even joy, anger, jealously, frustration, or separateness. Everything is perfect either for our growth or our enjoyment.
quotes.author: Ken Keyes Jr.

quotes.text: For me it is sufficient to have a corner by my hearth, a book and a friend, and a nap undisturbed by creditors or grief.
quotes.author: Fernandez de Andrada

quotes.text: Only in the darkness can you see the stars.
quotes.author: Martin Luther King Jr.

quotes.text: If you're reading this...Congratulations, you're alive. If that's not something to smile about, then I don't know what is.
quotes.author: Chad Sugg

quotes.text: There is some good in this world, and it's worth fighting for.
quotes.author: J.R.R. Tolkien

quotes.text: It's amazing how a little tomorrow can make up for a whole lot of yesterday.
quotes.author: John Guare

quotes.text: In a time of destruction, create something.
quotes.author: Maxine Hong Kingston

quotes.text: Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened.
quotes.author: Dr. Seuss

quotes.text: Crying is all right in its way while it lasts. But you have to stop sooner or later, and then you still have to decide what to do.
quotes.author: C.S. Lewis

quotes.text: We need never be ashamed of our tears.
quotes.author: Charles Dickens

quotes.text: Libraries were full of ideas–perhaps the most dangerous and powerful of all weapons.
quotes.author: Sarah J. Maas

quotes.text: Daring ideas are like chessmen moved forward. They may be beaten, but they may start a winning game.
quotes.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quotes.text: An idea that is not dangerous is unworthy of being called an idea at all.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.text: No army can withstand the strength of an idea whose time has come.
quotes.author: Victor Hugo

quotes.text: Take up one idea. Make that one idea your life, think of it, dream of it, live on that idea. Let the brain, muscles, nerves, every part of your body, be full of that idea, and just leave every other idea alone. This is the way to success.
quotes.author: Swami Vivkananda

quotes.text: A man may die, nations may rise and fall, but an idea lives on.
quotes.author: John F. Kennedy

quotes.text: Any idea, plan, or purpose may be placed in the mind through repetition of though.
quotes.author: Napoleon Hill

quotes.text: If you haven't found it yet, keep looking. Don't settle. As with all matters of the heart, you'll know when you find it. And, like any great relationship, it just gets better and better as the years roll on.
quotes.author: Steve Jobs

quotes.text: If you have an apple and I have an apple and we exchange these apples then you and I will still each have one apple. But if you have an idea and I have an idea and we exchange these ideas, then each of us will have two ideas.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.text: And the idea of just wandering off to a cafe with a notebook and writing and seeing where that takes me for awhile is just bliss.
quotes.author: J. K. Rowling

quotes.text: Be yourself; everyone else is already taken.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.text: Ideas come from everything.
quotes.author: Alfred Hitchcock

quotes.text: Be less curious about people and more curious about ideas.
quotes.author: Marie Curie

quotes.text: The ideals which have always shone before me and filled me with joy are goodness, beauty, and truth.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.text: The problem is that the people with the most ridiculous ideas are always the people who are most certain of them.
quotes.author: Bill Maher

quotes.text: Integrity is the ability to stand by an idea.
quotes.author: Ayn Rand

quotes.text: If you want something new, you have to stop doing something old.
quotes.author: Peter F. Drucker

quotes.text: That's the great secret of creativity. You treat ideas like cats: you make them follow you.
quotes.author: Ray Bradbury

quotes.text: We are set in our ways, bound by our perspectives and stuck in our thinking.
quotes.author: Joel Osteen

quotes.text: I can't understand why people are frightened of new ideas. I'm frightened of the old ones.
quotes.author: John Cage
